content.description: Start in front of a flat sided boulder with a jagged narrow top climb up to a good perch and then follow a run out face, veering generally right, through discontinuous cracks to to a bolted anchor.  The climb stays left of the low angle offwidth and right of the crack that is “obscure origins”.  The first 30 feet or so are unprotected face climbing but is featured a low angled.
content.protection: Single rack from .4-#3.  Most of the protection is in horizontal cracks if you’re avoiding the vertical cracks to the left and right of the climb.
content.location: Climber’s right of the low angle  off-width  with the bushes at it’s base. Central left side of the crag.

content.description: Hand and Crusty offwidth-ish Crack   Some crumbly rock collected in upper cracks.   (beware rope snags on the rap)
content.protection: Medium Nuts to Large Cams (mixed),   Newer Bolted Anchors on top
content.location: To the left/center of "Brazilian Tenant Farmers",   Start under the Tree   Climb past Rock Jumble to Handcrack Left to top
Furthest route Left and Up in this area

content.description: Fun face climb that starts a little more vertical but eases off quickly.  Good for a practicing leader.
content.protection: 3 bolts, to good two bolt anchor
content.location: Right side of Rosetta Stone area on top of a large boulder pile. (Red route in the photo)

content.description:
A fun, short, handcrack with plenty of features to use inside and outside the crack.  

   Start in a small pod on top of the boulder pile next to “easy street”.  Climb straight up the short crack and move right onto the lower angle face once the crack starts to widen.  Protection becomes spares once you leave the crack but the angle and climbing is much gentler.  This route shares the two bolt anchor with easy street.  

  If the crack was 90 feet instead of 25 this would be a 4 star pitch.
content.protection: BD singles from 0.5- #3.  And/or a set of nuts. Two bolt anchor with quicklinks/ rap rings.
content.location: Located up and to the right of the mass of trees, right of Brazilian Tenet Farmers and climbers left of Easy Street on top of a large boulder pile.

content.description:
To the left/center of "Brazilian Tenant Farmers",   Start under the Tree   Climb past Rock Jumble to Handcrack Right,   Then large flake leading right to top at anchors for "Brazilian Tenant Farmers" 

  Soaks up PRO, shorter run,   belay person can see leader on the climb,   highly recommended for   1st time trad leaders.
content.protection: Small to Medium Cams,   Bolted Anchors at top

content.description:
Center of slab, Right in your face as you hop down from the last boulder on the approach trail. 

  Start right of rock jumble and vertical cracks,   follow face up past horizontal cracks.   At the top of a lower angled section, step up and left over a large crack and continue on slab to top
content.protection: Mixed Gear, One Bolt, bolted anchors

content.description:
Rosetta Stone is a low east-facing wall looking out over the McDowell Mountain Regional Area... 

  Great Beginning Lead Rock on mostly solid Granite.   Much less visited than other climbing areas in the   McDowell Mountains Area.
